headline: Army to bury General Attahiru Saturday at National Military Cemetery
summarized_story:
By: Kingsley Omonobi – AbujaThe Burial proceedings of the Chief of Army Staff (COAS), Late Lieutenant General Ibrahim Attahiru and 6 other senior officers who lost their lives in an air mishap in Kaduna is slated for today Saturday, 22 May 21.
A statement by the Director, Army Public Relations, Brig General Mohammed Yerima said, “It will commence at the National Mosque and National Christian Centre, Abuja by 1000hrs respectively.
“Consequently, the internment for the late COAS and 6 other senior officers will take place at the National Military Cemetery, Abuja today by 1300hrs (1 pm).
Also read:General Magashi in a condolence message said the Air mishap that claimed the precious lives of the Chief of Army Staff, alongside other senior officers and his aides represents a huge national disaster.
General Magashi sadly noted that although the late General died when his service is needed most, his short but eventful tenure as the Chief of Army Staff and over three decades of dedicated, selfless and patriotic service will never be forgotten.

headline: Restructuring: Ned Nwoko writes Buhari, wants President to grant full autonomy to LGA, State Assemblies, Judiciary
summarized_story:

True democratic independence at the local governments, state assemblies and the judiciary represent the trajectory of our search for a better Nigeria.

headline: No amount of money can buy my conscience, support
summarized_story:
Former President of Nigeria, Olusegun Obasanjo has claimed that no amount of money can buy his conscience or support.
He decried how the love of material things and money had displaced the values of honesty and hard work.

headline: Anger as road construction exposes Osun community to flood
summarized_story:
Residents of Koju Foam Community, located along the Osogbo-Ikirun highway have expressed concern over the flooding that has overtaken their locality.
Alade Ogundare, Chairman, Landlord Association and other community leaders who spoke with DAILY POST revealed that the Osun State Government is aware of their predicament.
“Upon receiving numerous complaints from residents of Koju Foam Community, Off Osogbo-Ikirun Road, Osogbo, our team visited the community to ascertain the impact of flood which we discovered was caused by the construction of the yet to be completed Osogbo-Ikirun Road.
“When the Urban Alert team visited the community, the chairman of Koju Foam Community disclosed that officials of the Osun State Government had visited the community several times.
“It could be seen that the runoff water from both sides of Biket Junction and Powerline Area was directed at Koju Foam Community.

headline: Attahiru’s Death: Buhari receives briefings from Defence Minister
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari, on Friday, received briefing from Bashir Magashi, the Minister of Defence, on the plane crash that claimed the Chief of Army Staff, Lt. Gen. Ibrahim Attahiru and other military officers.
The Minister gave the briefing at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.
Magashi was accompanied by the Chief of Defence Staff, Gen. LEO Irabor, Chief of Air Staff, Air Marshall Isiaka Amao and other senior officers.
Personal Photographer to the President (Presidency), Mr Sunday Aghaeze, confirmed this in pictorial reports in Abuja on Friday evening.
The Nigerian Army had on Friday announced the death of its Chief, Lt.-Gen. Ibrahim Attahiru and ten others in an ill-fated NAF aircraft near Kaduna International Airport on Friday.

headline: FG tasks Olympic federations on Tokyo games
summarized_story:
The Federal Government has called on the Chairmen, Caretaker Committees of the Olympic Federations to ensure they record more victories for the Country during the Tokyo Olympic Games.
The Honourable Minister of Youth and Sports Development, Mr. Sunday Dare made the call today in his office in Abuja when he received in audience the Chairman, Caretaker Committee of Badminton Federation of Nigeria, Mr. Francis Orbih.
Mr. Dare said that Nigeria stands the chance of winning more medals at the Tokyo Games, particularly with the recent development when a 15 year old Bolaji Eniola became the first Nigerian and African winner of gold medal during the Spanish Para-Badminton games which ended on Sunday.
The Minister therefore called on the Chairmen, Caretaker Committees of Federations to be more patriotic in nurturing and training players as well as athletes, so that Nigeria can record more successes during the games.
Speaking earlier, Mr. Francis Orbih said that his visit was to present Bolaji Eniola, the first Nigerian and African winner of gold medal during the Spanish Para-Badminton games to the Federal government, and to appreciate the Ministry for coming out in full to sponsor Para-Badminton games for the first time.

headline: Infantino wants overhaul of FIFA calendar
summarized_story:
FIFA president Gianni Infantino on Friday called for an overhaul of the international football calendar beyond 2024, insisting on a requirement to start with a “blank sheet of paper”.
“Let me be very clear: the starting point is not ‘the calendar is full and so nothing changes’,” he told the 71st FIFA Congress.
“The starting point is the exact opposite of that.
However, he argued at length Friday for FIFA to play a key role in rewriting the calendar.
“Today, big leagues generate billions in revenues from all over the world – and these revenues are distributed where?

headline: Onuachu favourite to win Belgium’s top award
summarized_story:
Super Eagles striker Paul Onuachu has been named among the three finalists for the 2020/21 Pro Footballer of the Year award, after enjoying a stunning season with KRC Genk.
The other two nominees are Club Brugges Dutchman Noa Lang and Beerschot’s forward Raphael Holzhauser.
Lang, who only arrived from Ajax in the summer, is the elegant 21-year-old attacking midfielder whose 16 goals and 11 assists in all competitions powered Brugges to the league title.
ADVERTISEMENTGenk’s Onuachu, though, is the favourite for the prestigious honour.
The Pro League will present the prize to the winner on Monday at a traditional gala to be hosted at the JAM hotel in Brussels.

headline: Super Falcons coach invites 25 for Summer Series tour of America
summarized_story:
Super Falcons head coach, Randy Waldrum has made a provisional list of 25 players for the upcoming Summer Series tour of the United States of America, where the nine-time African champions will play four-time world champions USA, Portugal and Jamaica.
Waldrum has made it known that 23 players will make the trip to the US, meaning two players will be dropped from the provisional squad.
ADVERTISEMENTTeam captain Asisat Oshoala, fresh from becoming the first African player to earn a UEFA Women Champions Cup gold, tops the list with veteran defender Onome Ebi, youthful goalkeeper Chiamaka Nnadozie, midfielder Halimatu Ayinde and forward Rasheedat Ajibade also called.
Waldrum has included 10 home-based players in the provisional squad.

headline: Ogun monarch to Senate: Rescue Leah Sharibu, before criminalising ransom payment
summarized_story:
THE Eselu of Iselu, Yewa North Local Government Area of Ogun State, Oba Akintunde Akinyemi yesterday asked the National Assembly to seek the release of Leah Sharibu and others from kidnappers before passing the bill to criminalise ransom payment to kidnappers.
The monarch condemned the Terrorism Prevention (Amendment) Bill, 2021 being considered by the Senate, describing it as misplaced, unpopular and needless.
ADVERTISEMENTThe Senate on Wednesday passed for second reading, a bill seeking a 15-year jail term for anyone caught paying ransom to kidnappers.
In a letter to the Senate President, Ahmed Lawan, Oba Akinyemi frowned at the bill, saying: “If we want the bill to be popular, the Federal Government should first rescue Leah Sharibu and other hundreds of innocent Nigerians who are still being held in kidnappers’ dens in all the nooks and crannies of our country, Nigeria.”

headline: Buhari shocked over Attahiru, others’ death
summarized_story:
From Juliana Taiwo-Obalonye, AbujaPresident Muhammadu Buhari has expressed sadness and shock over the air crash that claimed the Chief of Army Staff, Lt. Gen. Ibrahim Attahiru, and other military officers.
He said the crash “is one mortal blow to our underbelly, at a time our armed forces are poised to end the security challenges facing the country.”According to a statement by Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina, Buhari described them as “heroes who paid the ultimate price for peace and security in the land.”He condoled with families of the deceased, the military, and Nigerians in general and prayed that God receives the souls of the patriots.
President Buhari pledged that the departed would not die in vain.

headline: FG Rejects Govs’ Advice, Says No to Fuel Price Increase
summarized_story:
Peter UzohoThe federal government yesterday rejected recommendation by the Nigeria Governors Forum for an increase in the price of petrol, saying despite the huge under-recovery otherwise known as subsidy paid on the product, the current price of between N162 per litre and N165 per litre would remain.
The Nigeria Governors’ Forum (NGF) had last Wednesday recommended a petrol price of between N408.5/litre and N380/litre, and also called for immediate removal of petrol subsidy.
The NGF’s advice was based on the report of its committee headed by the Kaduna State Governor, Mallam Nasir el-Rufai, that full deregulation of petrol should be entrenched.
The minister said the current price would be retained until the ongoing negotiation with the organised labour was concluded.
“The current price of petrol will be retained in the month of June until the ongoing engagement with organised labour is concluded.

headline: NCC plans to deploy Device Management System to prevent phone theft
summarized_story:
Two weeks after the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) said it had issued 54 million people their national identity numbers, it is in the process of deploying a Device Management System (DMS).
A Device Management System will take this step even further, allowing the government even more access to what should be private information.
When there’s a central registry for IMEI, the police could identify the owners of lost and stolen phones thousands of times daily.

headline: Does the Nigerian government want safety or surveillance with its new IMEI policy?
summarized_story:
From July 2021, the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) will require Nigerians to submit their IMEI numbers to a Centralised Equipment Identity Register.
The International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) is a unique number used to identify a mobile phone.
With an IMEI number, a phone can be tracked, but more than that, it can also be used for identity theft and even cloning a phone.
AdvertisementIf a phone owner possesses their IMEI number, they could provide law enforcement agencies with this information to track these phones if they are stolen.
Adding IMEI data to this would mean that they can also get real-time location data on anyone.

headline: Economy still awaits FG’s 300,000-unit housing intervention 12months after
summarized_story:
The Nigerian economy, which is in dire straits at the moment, is still waiting for the federal government with its intervention in the housing sector as provided for in the economic sustainability plan (ESP) more than 12 months after that plan was inaugurated.
Housing was listed among growth sectors and the strategy was to provide 300,000 housing units yearly.
The strategy envisaged the creation of 1.8 million jobs, starting in 12 months and subsequently creating 1.5 million homes for families across the country.
About 82.9 million Nigerians were in poverty before COVID-19, according to the World Bank.
Among other things, the ESP strategy aims at easing bottlenecks in the delivery of social housing and delivering affordable homes through direct government interventions in housing construction.

headline: Why manufacturing can’t resolve vaccine crisis in Africa

Excluding Nigeria, countries including Senegal, South Africa and Rwanda are already seeing green light for manufacturing partnerships with the European Union listing them as centres for future manufacturing.
But in entirety, the capacity for vaccine manufacturing resides in five countries: Egypt, Morocco, Senegal, South Africa and Tunisia.

headline: FG to capture IMEI automatically, denies asking Nigerians to submit phone identity
summarized_story:
The Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) has denied reports that it asked mobile subscribers to submit the international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) of their phones to it from July, 2021.
In a statement on Friday, the Director of public affairs of the NCC, Ikechukwu Adinde, said the commission did not at any time issue a statement regarding the registration of IMEI by subscribers and it has no plans to do so.
“It is pertinent to state that the Commission is in the process of deploying a Device Management System (DMS).
The DMS will essentially protect subscribers against phone theft and will identify and enable the elimination of fake devices from the networks.
The system will capture IMEI automatically without any requirement for subscribers to submit same.”Adinde advised the general public to disregard the said publications, which have created the erroneous impression that telephone subscribers will be required to register their IMEI with their networks.

headline: Nigerians Not Required To Submit IMEIs – NCC
summarized_story:
Nigerians are not required to submit the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) of their phones from July.
This is according to the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) which denied media reports suggesting that the masses would have to submit their IMEIs to the Federal Government.
NCC in a statement issued on Friday by its spokesperson, Ikechukwu Adinde, said the commission is in the process of deploying a Device Management System.
“At no time did the commission issue a statement regarding the registration of IMEI by subscribers and it has no plans to do so,” he said.
“The system will capture IMEI automatically without any requirement for subscribers to submit same.”

headline: Nigeria: Subscribers’ Phone ID Will Be Captured Automatically, Says Comms Commission
summarized_story:

There were several media publications to the effect that the commission will require citizens to submit the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) of their phones to it from July 2021.
